item.title: Monday, February 13, 2017
item.description:
February 13, 2017

(more) Javascript!

  • Project #1 Due
  • Github Review
  • Student demos of simple to-do app

item.title: Github
item.description:
Github

You should have uploaded your project to GitHub.

I recommend using the Github Desktop app for managing your projects in Github.

I will be working individually at the beginning of class with anyone that needs a little refresher on GitHub.

You can read this guide if you just need a little bit of guidance or a refresher.

item.title: Revisiting Javascript
item.description:
The To-Do App

Over the weekend you worked on a small to-do application.

Feel free to save you work somewhere, but I’d like to make sure that we are going to continue working on the same codebase.

Please visit my completed version of the app and view the source code. Use the source code to create a new (or overwrite your current version of) index.html file.

Let’s walk though this together.

item.title: Homework
item.description:
Homework (all readings due on Wednesday, February 15)

  • Read Learning from “Bad” UI
  • Read #01, #02, and #03 from UX Crash Course
  • Read Design for Real Life

Readings about UX in real life

These are all relative short reads. Please read them. Consider some experiences in your own life that could be described as UX Fails or UX Wins. Come prepared to discuss in class

  • Read McDonald’s New Menu — UX Fails (and 1 win)
  • Read Hilarious UX fail at the California Academy of Sciences
  • Read Uber’s UX Fail.

And a final article about Prevent UX fails with smart design

Loving this? Check out more – not for homework, but just for your reference!

  • A comprehensive reading list for young designers
  • A List Apart’s UX Category
